The electric force \( F_e \) is given by \( F_e = qE \).
The magnetic force \( F_m \) is given by \( F_m = qvB \).
Since the particle moves straight, \( F_e = F_m \), leading to \( E = vB \).
When the particle exits the electric field, it enters the magnetic field.
The magnetic force acts perpendicular to its velocity, causing it to move in a circular path.
The radius \( R \) of the circular path is given by \( R =  rac{mv}{qB} \).
The particle travels a semicircular path with diameter equal to \( L \), so the radius \( R \) of the semicircle is \( R =  rac{L}{2} \).
Substituting \( R =  rac{L}{2} \) into the radius equation \( R =  rac{mv}{qB} \), we solve for \( v \) to get \( v =  rac{qBL}{2m} \).
